title: Automatically configure public key authentication
author: scrobbleme
body_snippet:
## Expected Behavior

When configuring a (ssh) connection it should be possible to let mRemoteNG automatically setup keys and configure the client and server using this.

This would enhance security , as "basic" users must not handle key generation/setup and may not need to store passwords in mRemoteNG.

## Context

This feature is already available in [SmarTTY](https://sysprogs.com/SmarTTY/) and is very easy to setup there.

Quote from the website:

> Out-of-the-box public-key auth...

iterations.description: Feature request to auto-configure SSH public key authentication (e.g., auto-discover ~/.ssh/id_rsa or negotiate pubkey method), enhancing usability for SSH1/SSH2/OpenSSH connections.

notes:
AI triage (claude): Feature request to auto-configure SSH public key authentication (e.g., auto-discover ~/.ssh/id_rsa or negotiate pubkey method), enhancing usability for SSH1/SSH2/OpenSSH connections.
Approach: Add auto-discovery logic in OpenSSH and PuttyBase protocols to scan default key locations (~/.ssh/id_rsa, id_ed25519) when PrivateKeyPath is empty; optionally add an AuthenticationMethod enum (Password/PublicKey/Auto) to AbstractConnectionRecord to let users opt into automatic pubkey negotiation.
